botRequests.question: how to I add my home value (asset/investment) to counterbalance mortgage (liability)? Hi - I just added a new mortgage to my accounts. This obviously shows up as a liability. Is there a place to add in the value of my homes to show an appropriate net worth?
botRequests.answer:
Hi Peterfvint,

Thanks for reaching out. You can definitely add your home's value as an asset to balance out your mortgage liability and accurately reflect your net worth in Monarch Money.

Here's how you can do it:

**Option 1: Connect your home value via Zillow**
- On desktop: Go to the [Accounts page](https://app.monarchmoney.com/accounts), click "+ Add account," select "Add assets such as property, vehicles, & crypto," then choose 'Zillow.' Search for your home address, select the correct option, and save.
- On mobile: Open the Accounts tab, tap the '+' in the top right, select "Add assets such as property, vehicles, & crypto," choose 'Zillow,' search your address, and tap "Add account."
- This will automatically update your home's value monthly using Zillow's Zestimate.

**Option 2: Add a Manual Account for your home**
- If you prefer, you can create a [Manual Account](https://help.monarchmoney.com/hc/en-us/articles/360058187072) for your property and enter its value. You can update this balance anytime.

Once your home is added as an asset, your net worth will reflect both the property value and the mortgage liability.

Please let me know if you need anything else. 

Warm Regards, 
Mariposa
